abyss:
深渊 
a hole so deep or a space so great that it cannot be measured 
80
punctilious:
一丝不苟的 
very careful about behaving properly and doing things in a correct and accurate way
fluctuate:
波动 
to change level, strength, or value frequently
carcass:
尸体 
the body of a dead animal
inflame:
激怒 
to cause (a person or group) to become angry or violent

使发炎 
to cause (a part of your body) to grow sore, red, and swollen
underlie:
构成 的基础 
to form the basis or foundation of (an idea, a process, etc.) 
81
falsify:
篡改；伪造 
to make (something) false; to change (something) in order to make people believe 
something that is not true
marrow:
髓，精华 
a soft substance that fills the bones of people and animals
wayward:
任性的 
tending to behave in ways that are not socially acceptable
camouflage:
伪装 
a way of hiding something (such as military equipment) by painting it or covering it with 
leaves or branches to make it harder to see
irreverent:
不尊敬的 
showing a lack of respect for people or things that are generally taken seriously
anarchy:
无政府状态；混乱；无法无天 
a situation in a country, an organization, etc. in which there is no government, order or control
perceptual:
感知的 
of, relating to, or involving perception especially in relation to immediate sensory experience
quarantine:
为防传染的隔离期；检疫 
a period of time when an animal or a person that has or may have a disease is kept away 
from others in order to prevent the disease from spreading

对动物或人进行检疫，隔离 
to put an animal or a person into quarantine
amiss:
出差错的 
not proper or correct
sensuous:
愉悦感官的；给人以美感的 
affecting the senses in a pleasing way; pleasant, attractive, or appealing in a way that 
produces or suggests feelings of physical or sexual pleasure
seclude:
使隔开，使隔绝 
to keep (someone) away from other people
astray:
误入歧途的，迷路的 
off the right path or route 
82
armament:
飞机或军用车辆配备的武器，军械，火力装备 
weapons, especially large guns, bombs, tanks, etc.

武装；战备 
the process of increasing the amount of weapons an army or a country has, especially to 
prepare for war
prescribe:
规定 
to make (something) an official rule

开 药、处方等 
to officially tell someone to use (a medicine, therapy, diet, etc.) as a remedy or treatment
compelling:
引人注目的 
very interesting; able to capture and hold your attention
inverse:
相反 
something that is the opposite of something else

相反的 
used to describe two things that are related in such a way that as one becomes larger the 
other becomes smaller
quantum:
量子的 
of, relating to, or using the principles of quantum theory
descend:
下降 
to go down; to go or move from a higher to a lower place or level
perish:
死亡 
to die or be killed

毁灭 
to disappear or be destroyed; to cease to exist
savant:
博学之士；学者；专家 
a person with great knowledge and ability

独通一行的人；独开一窍的人 
a person who is less intelligent than others but who has particular unusual abilities that 
other people do not have
headlong:
轻率地 
without taking time to think about your actions
prosecute:
起诉，控告；检举 
to hold a trial against a person who is accused of a crime to see if that person is guilty
convoluted:
旋绕的 
having many twists and curves

晦涩的，复杂的 
very complicated and difficult to understand 
83
pittance:
少量报酬 
a very small amount of money
mandate:
授权 
to officially give (someone) the power to do something

命令 
to officially demand or require (something)
ungainly:
人、兽、车船 笨拙的，难看的 
awkward, clumsy, lacking grace
trivialize:
使显得琐碎或简单 
to make (something) seem less important or serious than it actually is
patriarchy:
父权制，男性家长制 
a social system in which family members are related to each other through their fathers
rumbling:
持续而低沉的声音；隆隆声；辘辘声；咕噜声 
a long deep sound or series of sounds

情况恶化的迹象，传闻；怨言

feign:
装作，假装；冒充 
to pretend to feel or be affected by (something)
desolate:
地方无人居住的；荒无人烟的；荒凉的 
(of a place) empty and without people, making you feel sad or frightened

孤独凄凉的；不幸的；忧伤的 
very lonely and unhappy

使感到悲惨；使感到凄凉；使悲伤绝望 
to make somebody feel sad and without hope
heretofore:
此前迄今 
up to this time, before now, until now

争论； 尤指讲价 
to argue with somebody in order to reach an agreement, especially about the price of something
impel:
促使；驱策；逼使

embody:
具体表现，体现，代表 思想或品质 
to express or represent an idea or a quality

包括；包含；收录 
to include or contain something

accusatory:
非难的，指责的

transfix:
使呆住，使动弹不得

刺穿 钉住 
to pierce with a sharp object
infuse:
把 注入；灌输 泡制 草药，沏茶 
to fill someone or something with an emotion or quality;leave substances such as tea leaves

scrutinize:
仔细检查 
to examine (something) carefully especially in a critical way
blare:
发出响亮刺耳的声音 
to make a loud and usually unpleasant sound
snatch:
一把抓起；一下夺过 
to take something quickly and often rudely or roughly

抓紧时间做；乘机获得 
to take or get something quickly, especially because you do not have much time
impassioned:
充满激情的 
showing or feeling very strong emotions
shuffle:
拖着脚步走 
to slide your feet along the ground or back and forth without lifting them completely
stratum:
地层，岩层 
one of usually many layers of a substance (such as rock)

社会阶层 
a level of society made up of people of the same rank or position
woo:
争取 的支持；寻求 的赞同 
to try to get the support of somebody

男子 追求异性 ；求爱 
(of a man) to try to persuade a woman to love him and marry him
allege:
未提出证据而断言，指称，声称 
to state without definite proof that someone has done something wrong or illegal
residue:
剩余物；残留物；残渣

exalt:

赞扬

spruce:

the year

人 整洁漂亮的 
neat, clean, or stylish in appearance
yearn:
渴望，向往 
to feel a strong desire or wish for something or to do something
alienate:
使疏远 
to make (someone) unfriendly; to cause (someone) to stop being friendly, helpful, etc., 
towards you
bruise:
使 出现伤痕；撞伤；擦伤 
to develop a bruise, or make a bruise or bruises appear on the skin of somebody/something

打击；挫伤 
to affect somebody badly and make them feel unhappy and less confident

青肿；瘀伤；碰伤

水果或蔬菜的碰伤，伤痕 
a mark on a fruit or vegetable where it is damaged
chafe:

to become irritated or annoyed

擦破

lush:
茂盛的

豪华的

skew:
歪曲 
to change (something) so that it is not true or accurate

prowess:
精湛技艺

柔软性 ；脆弱；娇嫩

仔细；温柔

棘手；微妙

intricate:
错综复杂的

批准离开

penchant:
偏好

engrave:
雕刻

slimy:
谄媚的，虚伪的
